name: Rosa Suviranta
title: Doctoral Researcher
bio: I am a doctoral researcher at the University of Helsinki, where I am part of the [Multimodality Research Group](https://www.helsinki.fi/en/researchgroups/multimodality) and the Doctoral Programme in Language Studies. Currently, I am at Northeastern University's Civic AI Lab (as of October 2025).

My research focuses on scaling up the annotation of multimodal data through microtask crowdsourcing. I am particularly interested in fair crowdsourcing practices while maintaining efficiency. Additionally, I am exploring how multimodal large language models and other AI applications can be used for annotating complex data.
In 2024, I received the Fulbright-KAUTE Foundation Award to support my research on fair and effective crowdsourcing for digital humanities, which facilitated my visit to Northeastern University.
